data.formatted_address: 8C8M+4WC, Wulingyuan District, Zhangjiajie, Hunan, China, 427403
data.name: Zhangjiajie National Forest Park

reviews.text: A stunning, breathtaking and awe-inspiring place. The inspiration for Pandora in the Avatar movie. An absolute must-see. The best time to see will be in early winter as the place will appear mythical and magical in the mist. The park comprised of dense forests, deep ravines, deep canyons, unusual peaks, caves, and pillar-like rock formations blanketed throughout the park. These pillar rock formations are what the park is renowned for around the world.

I Highly recommend getting the unlimited cable car ride pass and riding each cable line several times, up and back.
This place is so beautiful you simply cannot stand and take it all in.
Make sure to walk along the Gold Whip stream. I’d highly recommend walking down to gold whip stream from the avatar (hallelujah) mountains. This gets you away from the tourists and gives you great views of the peaks as you descend down to the valley.
We are English speaking only and we’re able to find our away around, make sure to get a white paper map and keep with you because the maps posted on the brown signs throughout the park are SO confusing. But the large folding white map from the info kiosks were great.
We bought the pass that gave you unlimited bus rides, elevator, and cable rides. It was 518 rmb per person. We did the math and everything we wanted to do was cheaper, but are very thankful we decided not to pinch pennys and got the unlimited because travel time to each attraction took a while (riding bus and walking, so it was nice to ride the elevator and cable rides over and over while we were there.

Also, the shuttle bus system here was amazing. Lines are long but they move fast, just like an amusement park.

Zhangjiajie National Park is an absolute marvel, boasting some of the most breathtaking views on the planet. From towering sandstone pillars shrouded in mist to lush valleys carpeted with emerald foliage, every corner of the park is a feast for the eyes. The sheer scale and otherworldly beauty of the landscape leave visitors in awe, making it a photographer's dream and a paradise for nature lovers.

One of the park's main attractions is its network of hiking trails, offering visitors the chance to immerse themselves in its pristine wilderness. Whether trekking along winding pathways that lead to panoramic viewpoints or venturing deep into the heart of the forest, each hike is an adventure filled with discovery and wonder. The diversity of terrain ensures there's something for hikers of all skill levels, from leisurely strolls to more challenging expeditions.

Beyond its natural wonders, Zhangjiajie is also steeped in cultural significance, with ancient temples and cultural landmarks scattered throughout the park. These historical sites add depth to the visitor experience, offering insights into the region's rich heritage.

In summary, Zhangjiajie National Park is a testament to the beauty and power of nature, offering visitors the chance to witness landscapes that seem straight out of a fairy tale. With its amazing views and captivating hiking trails, it's an experience that will leave a lasting impression on all who visit.

This place was very beautiful and awesome scenery, it's one of the movie scenery shots (Avatar) Walk way and climbing staircase is far and long but worth to have a look and take pictures, air is very fresh. Food store and toilet only available at the upper mountain there (middle of the walking trip)

Cons: This place not well maintain and less security guard. Beware of cutting queue and pushing you from the back while crouded, usually those old folks. Those old folks are very rude and unpolite.

Dubious AAAAA rating standard

The tickets include only the vans and buses taking you from places to places in the park. Everything else requires buying tickets, such as the cable cars and the elevator. The former is pretty worth the price because you can be among those highlight pillars, but the latter is just a waste of money. The part where you can see things was so short. Let alone you’ll get no views when it’s crowded and it’s always crowded.

The toilets are disasters. We were totally doubtful when we learned that this place is given 5A, which is the highest rating for tourism from the authorities.

Once in a lifetime is more than enough.

data.name: Zhangjiajie Grand Canyon （Southwest Gate）

reviews.text:
Visit on Monday, 11 March 2024

Stunning and picturesque views of the Zhangjiajie Grand Canyon on both sides from the Glass Bridge.

Zhangjiajie Glass Bridge is the world's longest and highest glass bridge, spanning over the mesmerising Zhangjiajie Grand Canyon.

In March, the weather is cool in the morning, but it gets sunny in the afternoon. Layered clothing is recommended.

The glass-made bridge might be the iconic spot for this park. You can experience the bungee jump from the bridge. Also there are some entertaining facilities like zip line and long slides for heading down the hill.
Same place with glass bridge very beautiful scenery charming view specially those who joined bungee jump or zip line where all deep canyon under them

It was fun walking around the glass bridge. Zhangjiajie Glass Bridge was the longest and the tallest glass bridge in the world when it opened. And it has 430 m long and 300 m above the ground. This place also offers Bungie jump, Zipline, 4D-VR and a glass terrace on the cliff.

This place is beyond beautiful, a beautiful creation of God. Really worth visiting but what's challenging is the cable car going up/ down or the bus going up/ down. ⚠ There's a lot of walking to do and make sure if you doesn't want to pack with the crowd so leave early but not after 5:30pm. Really crowded but just too BEAUTIFUL 😍 NEVER REGRET OF VISITING but please stay alert all the time, it can be very dangerous too.

It can get quite busy with long lines, so it is important to avoid public holiday at all cost and not to stay with the large tourist groups when inside the park.  Best time to visit is Spring or Fall.
Check the weather before coming, it rains over 200 days a year, and rains 24 hours 3 to 5 days straight.

Beautiful, definitely worth visiting.

Typically transliterated as ZhangJiaJie.

best ever.. will come again to visit the rest of the park.
personally i think you should allocate 3 to 4 days stay nearby this park to enjoy the fullest.
by the way, the shuttle busses are prepared for the visitors although it was really crowded but the park's staf still managed to get all the visitor back to the entrance gate.

i went there with a group of 4 persons on the end of November last year. The next 2 days after we check out, it starts to snow! The 1st snow that we're waiting for but we already booked our next stay at the phoenix town AKA Feng Huang so we have to leave Wulingyuan Town..
new experience, good experience 🥰

reviews.text:
Look… If you’re in Zhangjiajie, you have to come here. It’s one of the main things people see when they come here.
The bridge is impressive and a cool novelty. The scenery is pretty. It’s super touristy and a bit… artificial?? I can’t quite find the word…
It’s cool in general though. Great facilities with clean toilets. Recommend.

It was a great experience walking on the glass bridge. It would have been much scarier if was crystal clear. The day we were there was a bit misty and hence it was not crystal clear looking down.  The view from the bridge was beautiful.
To get down the canyon, you could get the 'experience package' that includes the lift, zip line, and the slide down the canyon after the bridge walk. This place is just more thn words.
It's amazing
It's beautiful
Amazing views .. amaIzng activities.
But better do not go in summer
You should go in winter
You can spend full day there.

data.formatted_address: China, Hu Nan Sheng, Zhang Jia Jie Shi, Ci Li Xian, 306省道CMGW+Q33 邮政编码: 427234
data.name: Zhangjiajie Grand Canyon

reviews.text:
One of the highlights of our Zhangjiajie Tour. Zhangjiajie Grand Canyon is famous for its Glass Bridge, which is the longest and highest outdoor glass bridge in the World.

Stunning landscape and scenery on both sides of the Grand Canyon.

Weather in early March is pretty cold, but it gets warm and sunny in the afternoon.

Grand Canyon and the Giant glass bridge, 大峡谷，玻璃桥。The trial is, we need to walk down the valley and cross the bridge from the other side of the mountain.  along the way you can see all the amazing valley, mountains, rocks and a waterfall which flow out from the middle of the rock mountain.  On the way of walking up, there is a elevator that help you to saved a few steps, but generally you still need to do a lot of hiking.  When you are on the top of the mountain, the giant glass bridge is waiting for you, u need to cross the bridge go back to the main building complex. Enjoy the scary moment and enjoy the beautiful scenery of the Grand Canyon.

A must-see. Most people visit this place to walk on the glass bridge, but it has a lot more to offer. The glass bridge itself is interestingly built, using big glass plates. However, since many people have walked on them, their transparency is a bit lower than expected. Do take the time to visit the grand canyon as well. It showcases nice extremely blue rivers, special fauna and has some typically Chinese extra's, such as a slide, a death ride (both for 30 yuan pp) and a free boat ride. Worth the time.

Good views from the glass bridge, although it's not entirely glass, only glass pieces within the metal bridge. The bridge is not as scary as it seems, people just made a big deal about it. Just walk through it! Hugeeeeee crowds even though it's not peak season, you won't be able to get a picture without people in the background. Walking sticks or huge-sized cameras are not allowed.

Real challenge comes when walking the 1680 stairs down to the canyon. Not recommended for people who're not physically fit in case your legs go weak.

The walk along the river is easy with walking paths nicely laid. Get prepared with umbrella or raincoats as you'll get wet while walking along the river due to multiple waterfalls along.

A boat ride to end the visit to the grand canyon. Mountain/canyon view is good too.

Recommended to visit once in your lifetime for the magnificent views despite of the never ending crowds.

If you want to know whether you are afraid of height or no, then you should try this one haha. The bridge connected two-top of the hills, but the glass is only placed in the mid section of the bridge hehe.

It's quite entertaining, as it is the first for me to step on this glass bridge. It sometimes can be too crowded, but managed to take photos on some of the glasses when not many ppl ard haha.

You need to buy the ticket at least one day in advance, and you need to enter at the allocated time. If not, your ticket will be gone. Just bring some essential things, no DSLR, no mirrorless. Or you need to put this on the storage room, and get this back when you finished (the entrance and the exit is on a two different area).

After glass bridge, theres also a trekking at the Zhangjiajie grand canyon (optional)

reviews.text: Embark on a transcendent journey to the summit of Tianmen Mountain via its renowned cable car. Prepare to be spellbound by the sheer majesty of the landscape unfolding beneath you. As you ascend, verdant forests, jagged cliffs, and misty valleys come into view, painting an awe-inspiring panorama that defies description. The gentle sway of the cable car only enhances the sense of wonder, offering a serene yet exhilarating experience. Whether you're a nature enthusiast, a photography aficionado, or simply seeking a moment of tranquility, this cable car trip promises to leave an indelible mark on your soul.
It's a very scenic ride that takes about 28 minutes. You must absolutely try to come here early in the morning to avoid huge crowd. I was here at 9 am and it was a bliss to go up the cable car.
The view from cable cabin is amazing but the waiting time is so long.

Take the cable. Don't take the bus. It is just too tired.
You can take the picture of the bus road when you up there instead. Nice as a picture as well. Lol.

There are two route of the cable.
A: the route from the city (8 people/cable)
B: the route start from the same place as route A but it start with a bus to take you to the fox village and take the cable from there (26 people/cable).

I took the B up and the A down.
Both nice.

Just that the A one take you through the city very close to road before it end. That is a liltle new to me Lol.

Zhangjiajie is part of a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Specifically, the  Zhangjiajie National Forest Park, was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1992. This area is renowned for its unique and spectacular karst sandstone formations, lush forests, and rich biodiversity.

data.formatted_address: China, Hu Nan Sheng, Zhang Jia Jie Shi, Yong Ding Qu, 306省道南庄坪 邮政编码: 427000
data.name: Tujia Folk Customs Park

reviews.text:
Tujia Folk Customs Park, also known as Tujia Ethnic Village, is a cultural attraction located in Zhangjiajie, Hunan Province, China. It offers a captivating glimpse into the traditional lifestyle, architecture, and customs of the Tujia people, one of China’s minority ethnic groups.

Visitors to the park are welcomed by the stunning wooden architecture, characterized by intricate carvings and vibrant colors. The traditional stilted houses, known as diaojiaolou, are a highlight, offering insight into the unique building techniques of the Tujia people. The layout of the village mimics an authentic Tujia settlement, complete with lush greenery and water features.

Here you can buy a silver jewelry. The park’s staff are friendly and knowledgeable, providing valuable context and make sure to download WeChat or google translate, or better yet find a local guide who can speak English.

This is a tourist spot no doubt it's an attraction however once you finished the tour there's some silver product and snacks the snacks is delicious. On the way out there's more shops that sells local products.

Nice and quiet place to learn about the local Tujia Folk customs with a guided native guide (audio headset included with entrance fee).

There's a traditional "crying wedding" show included in this Tujia Folk customs guided tour.

After the tour at the exit out, there's a large Silver Jewellery shop selling genuine 999 silver jewellery, silver mug, etc..

Visited here in March 2024 as part of our Zhangjiajie tour. 1-2 hours here is good enough to explore the whole place.
It's a nice cultural place, unfortunately it rained. Would be better if they practice crowd control

A nice walk to the Waterfalls and back
问天台 is also worth a quick stop.

reviews.text: 2 hours is enough, don’t have lockers for a backpack so had to do all the walking inside the cave with my (thanks small) backpack. A lot of construction within the cave, more than usual and lost a little bit of nature. Still beautiful and worth going with low expectation. No discount for seniors, seniors discount only for locals.

Physically Challenging and I won't recommend to anyone with bad knees, unfit or elderly persons.

Visited this Yellow Dragon Cave (Huanglongdong) on Monday, 11 March 2024 as the original optional tour "Fairy Fox Show" was cancelled (under renovations).

Only a short boat ride (less than 10 mins) inside the cave, but there's a long treacherous walk up and down the narrow, steep, wet, slippery steps uphill and downhill...

There's a total of 4 stages of physically demanding walking after the boat ride. Stage 3 is the resting point and short cut to the cave exit. But even that, it's still a long 20-30 mins walk from Stage 3 to the exit.

Kindly take note that the "rude" young lady cave Guide will not allow anyone to turn back and drop out, and will try to coax anyone to complete this long physically Challenging cave walk.

Yellow Dragon Cave (Huanglongdong)
Not recommended for elderly persons and persons weak knees as this is an extremely challenging and physically demanding cave trail.

Only a short boat ride inside the dark cave. Followed by a long walk up and down the steep, narrow and slippery steps uphill and downhill to the exit.

Take note there's no TURNING BACK once inside the cave.

The cave system was beautifully, colourfully, illuminated. The area outisde the cave is nice as well there was a farm, river nearby, beautiful collection of ancient water wheels, inside the cave Involves walking for about 1 to 2 hours depends on how fast you walk and i think there is option the do less walk less as well by taking the boat back, we finished the full tour in 3 hours by 1 way boat ride and full walking in 3 hours its was wort it, we managed to do the tour without a guide but I guess local guides give cave system information
Nice and clean experience in caves. with proper trail to walk. Remember to take the boat ride. Do pay this or you will have to walk a distance.

data.formatted_address: 8GQG+G5W, Wulingyuan District, Zhangjiajie, Hunan, China, 427499
data.name: Wulingyuan

reviews.text:
First, it is a very large area with an insane amount of walking up and down stairs. If you are like kung fu panda who hates stairs, avoid like the plague.
Second, very poor signages and total chaos as even the locals are lost like everyone else. For a world famous destination it has a very lowly standard of providing clear directions, customer service and  crowd control.
Third, only the Avatar area is amazing. Forget the rest.
Four, it is too expensive.
Five, it is merciless and indifferent to physically challenged people and senior citizens. It is quite clear that this park doesn't welcome such categories of people.
The sights are truly amazing ! Really fortunate that we managed to see the mountains and had a lovely walk in the canyons !

Wulingyuan, an awe-inspiring natural wonder, is renowned for its majestic mountains, often referred to as the Avatar Mountains due to their striking resemblance to the floating mountains depicted in the movie "Avatar". This spectacular area, encompassing 48 uniquely shaped peaks, stands as a testament to nature's artistry, drawing visitors from around the globe.

Each of the 48 mountains in Wulingyuan boasts its own distinct character, with towering pinnacles and lush greenery that create a breathtaking panorama. The region's beauty is further enhanced by the mists that often shroud the peaks, lending an ethereal quality to the landscape. This misty veil adds an element of mystery and enchantment, making every view feel like a glimpse into an otherworldly realm.

The flora and fauna of Wulingyuan are as diverse as its topography. The area serves as a sanctuary for a wide array of wildlife, and its dense forests are home to numerous plant species, some of which are rare and endemic. The harmonious coexistence of such biodiversity adds another layer of allure to this natural paradise.

The national park, specially in this part and since 2019, has become a theme park.
It is more than overcrowded (even in low season) with rude locals who do not respect anything and who push to the extreme in the queues to get on the bus, the cable car, the lift, etc. Sometimes it even becomes dangerous.
Local guides or bus drivers do not speak a word in English and do not put energy in trying to help you. The park is not even well signposted.
It is a shame that such a marvel of nature has  just been turned into a artificial theme park.

Wulingyuan national park is a scenic and historical site. This is also an UNESCO site listed in 1992. The park is very big, you can take up to one full day to hike along the many ravines and gorges with picturesque streams, pools, lakes, rivers and waterfalls. Its better to carry a park map with you, just in case you lost your sense of direction.

reviews.text: Fantastic park that is well laid out for the insane amount of tourist that come. Well thought out system of free public buses. Only issues is that not all locations are accessible by the buses unless you enter from different locations. So if you book a 4 day ticket you may want to book hotels near other entrances. Lots of trails are available to walk.
Very nice park. Actually feels like you are in avatar.
It is much better than huangshizhai, I think. The wulongzhai and the tianbofu is the perfect place. The tianbofu is the best view place. But it is some dangerous to get there.

I'm in love with this place!

The nature is wonderful and I met there a lot of very kind people and people who wanted to take picture with me, ..or they just took pic of me.

Entrance Fee: full price 248RMB, student ticket for 126 RMB
Buses: FREE (inside of area)

TIPS
- it's good to deal with shoppers, because the water in the mountains is overpriced (5 RMB) - or buy water outside, near is a shop, it's cheaper
- have a fun and take a funny picture in some traditional Chinese dress
- if you have drone, you can use it here, it's worthy
- say "no, thank you" to random Chinese guider guys if you can't speak Chinese
- say "yes" to buying beautiful postcards of Zhangjiajie from famous photographer for 25 RMB
- it's enough to spend there 3 days... but 4 days are better! -> you can enjoy more the nature, feel the peace
Great place despite the rampant commercialism.  It's easy to get away from the commercialism once you stray off the spots that are serviced by the shuttle buses.

data.name: Zhangjiajie Railway Station

reviews.text:
Coming by train from Shanghai and leaving form this train station to Beijing.
Train journey from Shanghai to Zhangjiajie was more than pleasant. The train stuff did not speak English but they manage to inform us that we are closing to a station of our destination.
The Train station itself for arrivals is quite fine just go with the crowd and you will reach the exit.
The departure experience was much more complicated. The information boards and speakers communicate were Chinese only. Also, the train number from some reason was different than on ticket... so there is required a lot of showing off a ticket to strangers so they can point you in the right direction.
The smart move is to use VIP lounge. In VIP lodge you will be informed that you train will arrive soon and you will get a priority pass to a platform so you can be sure that you will not miss anything.
As for food options. There is mainly Chinese food selection. If you want to get some non-Chinese food you have to go out of the train station (thru the security) and go to nearby McDonalds. (about 100m from the train station)

We took a train to Canton, an overnight train. If you don't speak any chinese, I would not recommend that. It is difficult to understand what they say on the speakers, the personnel doesn't speak english and we had trouble to even turn off the music in our compartment.

Coming by train from Beijing is a pleasant experience. This is an overnight train, which is comfortable.
Recommended.
Greattt

Zhangjiajie West Station
It's a rural area that's connected to big cities to the east, west, south, and north, but it's a countryside that doesn't feel like a countryside.
To the east, Chongqing, to the north, Wuhan, to the east, Changsha, to the south, Guiyang.
But it seems difficult to get from the city by bus.
Taxi fare is about 35 yuan.

data.name: Wulingyuan Scenic Area

reviews.text:
Very pretty, and it’s a four day ticket so good to spend some time to just explore different areas of the park!

Bailong elevator was quite overrated in my opinion, but essential to help you get up to the top.

The crowds/your groups are insane, best to go really early!
Gorgeous place to visit. Strongly recommend you go. It was worth the trip. The city itself is also very cute. Very cool. Looks like a luscious green Grand Canyon. What a dream!

Wulingyuan Scenic Area is a breathtaking natural wonder located in the Hunan Province of China. It's renowned for its towering sandstone pillars, deep ravines, lush forests, and serene waterfalls. The landscape is dotted with thousands of unique rock formations, some resembling humans, animals, or mythical creatures. This UNESCO World Heritage Site offers a captivating blend of natural beauty and cultural significance, as it's home to several minority ethnic groups and ancient customs. Visitors can explore a network of trails, traverse narrow bridges, and take in the awe-inspiring vistas from viewpoints throughout the area. Wulingyuan Scenic Area truly is a remarkable testament to the power of nature's artistry.

Large area with different zones to view the Karst mountain formations in different perspectives.  There are buses (included in entrance ticket) connecting the different zones, but still require a lot of walking and climbing of steps to get around. Spent over three hours just walking through the Jinbianxi zone as there is no way to exit once you enter the path.  Cable cars and sky elevators to access the Tianzi Mountain area are charged separately. Views are stunning from Tianzi Mountain, so be sure to go on a relatively clear day.

Wulingyuan National Park is huge, if you had the time you should spend 4 days. The enterance ticket lasted for 4 days. To tour around best if you get a local guide which will help you getting on and off the free bus that took you from one scenic area to the next. Otherwise for someone that doesn't speak Chinese, competing for the bus spot is something that we are not used to. Some of spot that worth visiting are Hallelujah mountain  (Yuanjiajie) where the director of Avatar get its inspiration from, this mountain can be accessed using Bailong Elevator which is also something that is impressive to check out.

data.formatted_address: 2FXJ+63F, Yongding District, Zhangjiajie, China, 427302
data.name: Tianmen Mountain National Park

reviews.text: Really cool experience, worthy to see and visit. It’s very crowded and there is more way hot get up. The most popular is half an hour long cablecar but for example in august you have to buy tickets at least one week in advance. The other way to get up or not bad either 👍

Time well spent. You need one day to see all. Going up is best with the cable car (instead of bus). You get there in 30 minutes. However, queing took us around 1h (and it was not so busy). Try to book an early time slot and go in time. Once up the mountain, take the West line. The first part of the trail is crowded with tourists, but you'll get used to it. The glass covered sky walks are not perticularly interesting, since the glass has lost a bit of its transparency and looking over the edge gives you a similar view. The temple on the top of the mountain is magnificent. Take the time to visit it. You'll be amazed. From the temple onwards, the trails are less crowded. Go further untill Kunpeng Peak and get back to the Tianmen elevator to the Tianmen gate top. Finish your walk by walking  down the stairs and take your time to look around. No need to go back up. Take your bus back at the bottom.

Tianamen Mountain cave also known as Heavens door.

longest passenger cable car in the world which covers 7.5 kms of distance using its 98 cabins and takes the passengers to 4200 feet high. The entire distance takes around 30 minutes to complete using this cable car to reach the mountain top.

The cable car ride was worth every penny we spent on the RMB 250/- ticket. It’s hard to describe how it feels when you are climbing in it towards the heavens door; you really need to experience it yourself as I can’t find words to describe my feeling as you will too.

If it’s a full day trip you can relax and travel around the mountain in a slow pace

August 11th 2017: We went up by cable car and we descended by bus. Cable car it's really amazing and not recommended for those with panic (like me :P) the views are unique and the sensation of going through over the cliff it's amazing as you can see in the pictures. The door to the sky it's also unique, the 999 stairs are so vertical and built for small food so those with big feet will suffer a bit, even more if it rain and make the surface slippery!! I recommend you that if you come from the top and you descend it, to go up through them, it's a must! Up there there are some places that offer food and drink for reasonable prices
Breathtaking views and easy to walk and navigate tracks (actually it is a circle around the plateau). Very interesting glass walk experience.

data.name: Tianzishan Nature Reserve

reviews.text:
Tianzishan National Park stands as a testament to the awe-inspiring beauty of nature, offering visitors an unforgettable experience with its stunning vistas and exhilarating hiking trails. Nestled amidst the majestic peaks of the Zhangjiajie region, the park enchants visitors with its surreal landscapes and breathtaking views.

One of the highlights of Tianzishan is undoubtedly its panoramic viewpoints, which offer sweeping vistas of the surrounding mountains and valleys. From the iconic "Avatar Hallelujah Mountain" to the ethereal sea of clouds that often blankets the peaks, every turn presents a new and mesmerizing sight.

The park's hiking trails wind their way through forests of ancient trees and across precipitous cliffs, providing adventurers with a thrilling journey through some of China's most dramatic scenery. Whether embarking on a leisurely stroll or tackling a more challenging ascent, hikers are rewarded with unparalleled views and a sense of exhilaration that comes from being immersed in nature's grandeur.

In addition to its natural wonders, Tianzishan is also home to cultural landmarks such as the Tianzi Pavilion, which offers insight into the region's rich history and heritage. These sites add depth and significance to the visitor experience, further enriching an already unforgettable journey.

In summary, Tianzishan National Park is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking to be inspired by the beauty of the natural world. With its amazing views and exhilarating hiking trails, it offers an experience that is both enchanting and invigorating.

it’s a beautiful place, a pity it’s in China.. the experience is totally ruined by what seemed like never ending flocks of crows just relentlessly smashing into your face. the smell and the noise… god bless.

A majestic cave

It is a world-famous attraction where many people from all over the world challenge various extreme sports and perform 👍😌…

Tianmen Mountain Cableway is the best way to go up the mountain. Just go up the mountain ⛰️cable car🚠 and you will feel the difficulty of its engineering and the awesome design skills👍⋯⋯

Look down ⬇️👀 in mid-air, it’s so majestic! There is also the so-called Cake Road. Before arriving at the destination, we first went to the "Western Glass Plank Road". It is located on a cliff at an altitude of 1,430 meters. The guardrails and the ground are all made of high-strength tempered glass. It is very shocking and exciting. Known as the "Road to the Sky" in the East, it also passes through the famous "Li Na Villa" 🏡, which became famous in the music world due to her song "Qinghai-Tibet Plateau". It was originally the place where Li Na lived in seclusion on the top of Tianmen Mountain before she converted to Buddhism. I heard 👂 about her Now he has moved to the temple on the mountain to live permanently...

After taking the cable car, we arrived at 500M in front of Tianmendong Square and walked towards Tianmendong. Although the journey was short, the scenery among the beautiful mountains and streams was really indescribable! Arrive at the "Ladder to Heaven" to see the Tianmen Cave, it's so beautiful and spectacular🤔! Unfortunately, today due to the impact of the front, we were unable to climb the ⬆️Ladder to Heaven Trail to reach the top🆙"It's not that the mountain is so high up in the sky, there really is a ladder to Heaven"⋯⋯!

Guests can come here if you have the opportunity. It’s really a worthwhile trip!

Zhangjiajie Tianmen Mountain National Forest Park is a must-visit place when traveling to Zhangjiajie. From the moment you arrive at Zhangjiajie Airport, you will see the magnificent Tianmen Cave. Tianmen Mountain is located near Zhangjiajie Hehua Airport in Yongding District, making travel and accommodation very convenient. Test your physical strength with the 999 stairs in Tianmen Cave, and taking the elevator up the mountain is also the highest escalator in the world. View the cliffs on the Guigu Plank Road, and walk on the glass bridge which is exciting and fun.

The cable car in Tianmen Mountain was so scary that it was almost 85 degrees. I took the cable car from the city and crossed 3 mountains. It went up and down all at once. It was really special. However, you had to wait in line for a long time before taking the cable car. It is recommended to go to the toilet as soon as possible. Go to the queue again. There is no toilet when you queue up. The cost of this cable car is worthwhile. You must take it. Tianmen Mountain is a good place and everything in it costs money. In all of Zhangjiajie, only Tianmen Mountain is worth visiting. I heard that the snow scene there is very beautiful in winter, and only local people will go there.

In addition to the must-see Zhangjiajie National Forest Park in Zhangjiajie City, the Tianmen Mountain National Forest Park adjacent to the urban area is also very interesting. You can only use public transportation to go up and down the mountain. The park has one of the longest cable car routes in the world: Tianmen Mountain. Cableways, mountain climbing escalators, environmentally friendly vehicles (minibuses and buses), and a complete ban on private cars entering scenic spots are what I appreciate most about Chinese scenic spots.
Tongtian Avenue extends all the way from Tianmen Cave to the city. Private cars are not allowed to go there. You can only take the environmentally friendly vehicles in the scenic area to go up and down the mountain. The number of trains going up and down the mountain is very dense, with almost no interruption. The trains leave as soon as they are full.
The 10.77-kilometer-long Tongtian Avenue has a height difference of 1,100 meters. There are many hairpin turns and the road is narrow. Sitting in the car, you have to admire the driver's driving skills. Those who are prone to motion sickness remember to take motion sickness pills half an hour ago. Hey, this must be If you feel dizzy, you can slide your phone if you are not prone to motion sickness like me. The drive up the mountain takes about half an hour. Even though the scenery along the way is foggy.

Tianmen Mountain was known as Mengluo Mountain in ancient times. During the Three Kingdoms era in 263 AD, due to the influence of dissolution, the middle of the mountain wall collapsed, forming this natural cave. Sun Xiu, Emperor Wu Jing at the time, regarded this as an auspicious sign and renamed Mengluo Mountain. It is called Tianmen Mountain and has been passed down to this day.

After watching Tianmen Cave, you can choose to go up the mountain with the 999-step ladder or take the escalator. Every artificial construction has its pros and cons. The mountain-crossing escalator allows every tourist to go up and down the mountain in the easiest way, but in order to please tourists The practice of digging caves to build escalators has also attracted a lot of criticism. I think China is still looking for a balance point on how to attract tourists while also taking into account environmental protection (actually Taiwan is too~)

In winter, there is snow and ice on the mountain, and the cable car is undergoing routine maintenance, so you can only choose an environmentally friendly car to go up and down the mountain!
Mountain scenery photos taken in Tianmen Mountain or Zhangjiajie National Forest Park are suitable for conversion to black and white mode, turning them into landscape paintings in one second!

This institute presents many beautiful pictures of their Master "Lin Jun Sheng" amazingly painted with many stones and sand.

I loved this place!!! I'm really glad we made time to visit while we were in Zhangjiajie (we visited in spring 2018). It didn't take much time to walk through, probably about an hour, but it was so worth it. The art is BEAUTIFUL and very unique. I've never seen anything like it. There was a guide who spoke English and explained things to us very well. We couldn't resist buying a piece, which I keep on my work desk (see picture). There are more expensive pieces from the artist who created this style (the place is named after him - Junsheng) and more affordable pieces from his students, which is the kind we bought. They included the picture stand for free! We brought ours home in our suitcase, but they offer a packing and shipping service if you'd prefer. I would love to visit here again when I'm rich and retired to buy one of the four seasons sets by Junsheng himself. Those were my favorite!

data.formatted_address: Baofeng Lake, Wulingyuan District, Zhangjiajie, China, 427499
data.name: Baofeng Lake

reviews.text: Honestly, quite disappointing. The whole thing felt really fake - the actual lake is artificial so it just looks like an unatural flooded valley - becasue it is (and probably caused a ton of environmental damage). And then you go round on the boat past some people in costumes singing, which I know is symbolic and traditional but the way you just go past looking at them feels really inauthentic, like you're on a theme park ride. It was pretty I guess. I went in mid March and all the walking paths were closed, so literally the only thing you can do is go on a 5 minute bus, 20 minute boat and then bus back. There's a waterfall section with museum too but that's so small it can be seen in way less than 30 mins. So for ¥95 (for entry plus boat) it was not good value, felt like an inauthentic theme park and just boring. Wish I'd gone back into Zhangjiajie National Park instead.

Beautiful, scenic and picturesque lake in Wulingyuan, Zhangjiajie. If you go on a misty day, you can enjoy a Chinese landscape painting coming to life with the ethereal and mythical aura enclosing the locale. This is an artificial fresh-water reservoir created by blocking gorge and building dam in the 1970s
It is a high altitude lake. The water is very clear without pollution. Average depth is 72 m and the length is 2.5 km.
Great experience and enjoyed the scenery and cultural aspect of the boat trip with 啊哥 and 啊妹 singing.

Shape imagination while enjoying the lake view along with different rocky mountains is the main adventure of the Chinese traditional boat journey through the lake. The lake has an average depth of 72 meter with an maximum depth of 169 meter approximately. Mountain love songs are one of sweetest parts to enjoy the boat journey, sung by male & female, individually, they wait in two separate cottages located at the feet of mountains & when any boat crosses their cottage they start to sing loud to cheer the tourists.  It also includes a bus journey through the snaky mountain road. At the terminal point, there is also a natural flow of a large amount of water coming down to mountains feet. A small pond exists there, colorful fishes swim to get some adore from the cheerful tourists. A baby fish, age of almost 70, lives there in a pond, people gives him coins & notes to make fulfill the wishes they want. A baby fish lives nearly around 150 years of life span. It's about 4 feet in length & 12-15kg in weight. Moreover, you may have an amazing visit to Baofeng Lake for half a day if you plan to go there in near future.

reviews.text:
We stayed 4 nites.

When international big chains like Pullman come to China, the management is distinctly different from the rest of the world. This is considered the top best hotel in that area. The room is spacious but shows signs of age. No USB by the bed side, but at least sockets. Hand held shower in the bathroom has the strangest and impractical design. Bed is conformable, but room is way too warm (set of the hotel). Breakfast selections are geared towards local Chinese flavors and habits.

Room is big, staffs are nice, we went to local restaurant suggested by staff, was delicious but ironically hotel foods not taste good. Though breakfast got varieties but almost all have plain taste. Nevertheless it’s a decent hotel and services.

We stay in this hotel for a couple of nights with late check-in. We were charged 50% of the room price for the late check-out. Well… Surprisingly, most of the senior hotel staff are English speaking. However, once we checked out everyone pretended they don’t, which was pretty frustrating. Concierge service refused to help us loading our suitcases on departure and just left them at the door. Definitely unacceptable. There is no business centre in the hotel. USB socket didn’t work in our room. The hotel is pretty worn-out. Leaking hand shower is something that needs immediate attention. Once you exit the room you can’t see any signs showing direction to elevators. Chinese musical instruments in the tea room are not tuned and poorly maintained. The Guzheng has a missing string. These beautiful Instruments sitting without cover and sun protection. I don’t think we will stay here once again.

They did not turn on the AC for the whole hotel because it was "cold" outside, while inside my room it was a sauna. the answer to the question "will it be working tomorrow?" was - "maybe if it's sunny outside".
5 star hotel? nope. not even close.

reviews.text: It has mountains, sandstone pillars, lakes, streams, caves, gorges, fauna and UNESCO-World-Heritage-Site status, but Zhangjiajie isn’t your average national park. For one, it is said to have inspired Avatar, specifically the “floating” Hallelujah Mountains. It also has the world’s highest natural cave, and an outdoor elevator on a mountain (it just happens to be the “world’s fastest, tallest and largest load lift”). With natural spectacles galore, this scenic experience promises to be more than a walk in the park.
A dreamy place....

20240626 It was raining all over Zhangjiajie City. We took a high-altitude cable car up to Tianmen Mountain, walked on the glass plank road, and then took twelve extra-long escalators to descend to Tianmen Cave Square. The whole journey was covered by clouds and rain, and the fog locked the peaks. When we were disappointed, a sudden clear breeze and clouds broke through the sky and let us open. You can see Tianmen Cave and admire the dreamlike beauty of the bright lights of the Seventy-Two Strange Towers at night

Tianmen Cave is located in Tianmen Mountain in Zhangjiajie, Hunan Province, China. It is 131.5 meters high, 57 meters wide and 60 meters deep. It is the highest natural mountain cave in the world. Tianmen Mountain is 1,300 meters above sea level. History records the natural wonders of "Tianmen spitting fog", "Tianmen aura", "Tianmen turning over water" and "Tianmen turning".
Tianmen Mountain first appeared in the Sixth Year of Yong'an (263 AD) of the State of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period. A cave suddenly opened in Songliang Mountain. King Sun Xiu of Wu regarded it as auspicious, so he named it "Tianmen Mountain".

In December 1999, the world's aerobatic master flew a plane through Tianmen Cave, achieving the feat of humans flying through a natural cave for the first time, which caused a sensation all over the world.

In March 2006, the Russian Air Force performed an aerobatic display on Tianmen Mountain. It was planned to use heavy fighter Su-27 and Su-30 to pass through Tianmen Cave, but it did not materialize.

On November 18, 2007, French adventurer Alain Robert climbed to the top of the Tianmen Mountain Cave with his bare hands, taking only 40 minutes.

On September 24, 2011, the famous American extreme skydiver Jeb Chris successfully crossed the Tianmen Cave in Zhangjiajie wearing an unpowered wingsuit despite the failure of his first test flight.

【Zhangjiajie Tianmen Cave】

In the sixth year of Yong'an (263 years) of the Kingdom of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, a cave suddenly opened in Songliang Mountain. King Sun Xiu of Wu regarded it as auspicious, so he named it "Tianmen Mountain".

Tianmen Cave is 131.5 meters high, 57 meters wide, 60 meters deep and 1,300 meters above sea level. It is the highest natural mountain cave in the world. History records the natural wonders of "Tianmen blowing out fog", "Tianmen aura", "Tianmen turning over water" and "Tianmen turning". Local chronicles record that Tianmen Cave has "Ten Sceneries of Tianmen".

Time: 8:00-17:30; admission stops at 16:00

reviews.text: Took the cable car down the hill and the scenery was eye-widening.
great nature

The scenery of Tianzi Mountain has a wide view and a majestic taste. Tianzi Mountain Scenic Area is a place where strangeness, beauty, and wild beauty come together to create a trinity.

The majestic sight of the densely lined cliffs and strange peaks takes your breath away. In particular, it has the four famous sights of Undo, Wolhwi, Hail, and Dongseol, so the changes are endless. I will briefly write down three places that Tianzi Mountain is proud of. That is, Haryong Park, Eopilbong Peak, and Fairy Flowers.

Haryong Park
This is a park where a huge statue was erected to commemorate General Helong, the 10th Marshal of China. The statue is 6.5m tall and weighs 9 tons, making it the largest statue ever made in China. The text “Haryong Park” at the entrance to the observatory was written by General Secretary Kang Taek-min himself in March 1995. Koreans also have no reason to respect General Ha-ryong.

appeal pole
Eopilbong Peak is one of the world's most spectacular sights that you must see before you die. This place was named so because the appeal, a brush used by the emperor himself in the past, was placed here. The green pine tree growing on the stone peak looks like a paintbrush stuck upside down.

Fairy wreath
This place was named so because the wind blowing every spring and summer causes clouds to surround Seokbong (Dolbong Peak) and the appearance of a fairy standing on the top of the hill resembles a fairy. Wild flowers spread out like cotton fields at the bottom and waist of the mountain. Hundreds of peaks, large and small, rise up around it, and the winter snow scenery in particular is one of the most spectacular views in the world.
How can it look like this? I am jealous of the country called China.
very beautiful place

reviews.text: Beautiful stream in the Wulingyuan Scenic and Historic Interest Area. The stream stretches 7.5 km, flowing between steep grotesque peaks and luxuriant trees creating a fantastic hiking trail amidst the enchanting natural ecological environment.
It is a 7km walk , so you need to be prepared for the long walk. It is scenic and the sound coming from the stream is therapeutic. Relaxing and close to nature. Love the walk personally.
Even thou the crowded made it unbearable but the scenery is so very beautiful... Once a lifetime experience...
Nice stream, water is clear, air is fresh

The first forest park in Zhangjiajie, Golden Whip Creek is the main scenic spot in Huangshi Village containing Golden Whip Creek. Made famous by Wu Guanzhong
The most essential scenic spot in Zhangjiajie. If you like Golden Whip Creek, it just rained heavily this morning and it is very beautiful. Beautiful streams are paired with green mountains and forests, and the air is especially fresh.
Monkeys can be seen traveling through the mountains and forests everywhere on the way. The monkeys are not afraid of humans. The mother monkey catches insects and the baby monkeys are cute. Please do not feed the monkeys food, as this will cause a physical burden on them.

reviews.text: Good

The room equipment is a bit old and the breakfast is a bit bad. Compared with the five-star hotels I have visited in other Chinese cities before, it is a bit behind. But compared to the hotels I stayed in in downtown Zhangjiajie or Fenghuang Ancient Town, they were pretty good, at least they were clean.

Wi-Fi worked and breakfast was good. However, it's a little dark for writing.
Also, the windows are open, and if you don't close them, you can hear the chorus of frogs.
Regarding the bath, I prefer showers, so the shower curtain is a little short.
I was careful. Also, the drainage is not good. 2018/05/11 8909 room nights

This hotel is jointly owned by the same owner of Huasheng Travel Company. The hotel is old, the carpets are old and dirty and smell of dust mites and mold. The price is very messy. There is no standard price. It is a national tourist attraction and specializes in deceiving foreign tourists. The feeling is poor...

I was in the city at an international conference on inbound tourism to China because I was invited to join the delegation of Russian travel agents. I stayed at the hotel from June 7 to June 12.

ROOMS
Excellent! Comfortable, carpeted, the hotel beds are cool, soft and quite elastic. The bathroom is comfortably equipped and the thick cotton towels are very nice. There are rooms with city/river views.

TERRITORY
There is none as this is a business hotel. A small garden is all.

BREAKFAST
Of course I wanted it better. No variety. Every day the same thing. The only fruit is canned pineapple. From fresh - watermelon.

CONFERENCE HALL
On the second floor. Large and comfortable. There are several screens for broadcasts.

RESULT: For conferences and business meetings, although an ordinary tourist can stay for a couple of nights
